result.execSummary:
The defendant James R Alley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars.

The defendant must participate in anger management and/or psychological evaluation and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

records.addlTxt: Defendant James R Alley in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:33 AM. State - resolved. Richards provides Court with plea questionnaire. State - defendant will plead g/nc to each count as alleged, withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 month, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: court costs on each count, AODA and follow thru, anger managmenet and follow thru, psychological assessment and foloow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars, employment/school, 100 hours of community service, have complied with victim notification requirements with no response. Richards and Alley agree. Alley pleads NC to counts #1 and #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation. Richards makes final argument prior to sentencing, follow joint recommendation. Alley makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: court costs on each count - take bond posted and remainder due thru probation, AODA and follow thru, anger management and/or psychological evaluation and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 100 hours of community service total, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, right to appeal, adjourned.

James R. Alley appears with Attorney Mary Burns, specially for Steven Richards, Charles Simono appears for the State. Burns indicates Richards could not appear this morning and has obtained a JT date from JA. Alley would like to resolve but unsure why his attorney could not get a hold of him.

Defendant James R Alley in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:36 AM. Alley handed complaint in court. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Alley understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, would like to work out with the state without an attorney. State not prepared to make offer at this point. Recess to talk to SPD (9:37 AM). Recalled at 9:58 AM, now appears with Mary Burns. Burns waives reading, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, set for FPT on 12/16/15 at 2:30 PM, continues bond.
